original_solution_mapping.L1: Each tree A gives her six good oranges a month 10 x .6 = <<10*.6=6>>6
original_solution_mapping.L2: Each tree B gives her five good oranges a month because 15 x (1/3) = <<15*(1/3)=5>>5
original_solution_mapping.L3: On average, a tree gives her 5.5 oranges a month because .5(6) + .5(5) = 5.5
original_solution_mapping.L4: She has ten total trees because 55 / 5.5 = <<55/5.5=10>>10

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5914.
    Returns: the total number of trees Salaria has.
    """
    # L1
    tree_a_total_oranges = 10 # Tree A gives her 10 oranges a month
    tree_a_good_percent = 0.6 # 60% are good
    good_oranges_tree_a = tree_a_total_oranges * tree_a_good_percent

    # L2
    tree_b_total_oranges = 15 # Tree B gives her 15 oranges
    tree_b_good_fraction_numerator = 1 # 1/3 are good
    tree_b_good_fraction_denominator = 3 # 1/3 are good
    good_oranges_tree_b = tree_b_total_oranges * (tree_b_good_fraction_numerator / tree_b_good_fraction_denominator)

    # L3
    tree_a_proportion = 0.5 # 50% of tree A
    tree_b_proportion = 0.5 # 50% of tree B
    average_good_oranges_per_tree = tree_a_proportion * good_oranges_tree_a + tree_b_proportion * good_oranges_tree_b

    # L4
    total_good_oranges_per_month = 55 # 55 good oranges per month
    total_trees = total_good_oranges_per_month / average_good_oranges_per_tree

    # FA
    answer = total_trees
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Each tree A gives her six good oranges a month {tree_a_total_oranges} x {tree_a_good_percent} = <<{tree_a_total_oranges}*{tree_a_good_percent}={good_oranges_tree_a}>>{good_oranges_tree_a}

Each tree B gives her five good oranges a month because {tree_b_total_oranges} x ({tree_b_good_fraction_numerator}/{tree_b_good_fraction_denominator}) = <<{tree_b_total_oranges}*({tree_b_good_fraction_numerator}/{tree_b_good_fraction_denominator})={good_oranges_tree_b}>>{good_oranges_tree_b}

On average, a tree gives her {average_good_oranges_per_tree} oranges a month because {tree_a_proportion}({good_oranges_tree_a}) + {tree_b_proportion}({good_oranges_tree_b}) = {average_good_oranges_per_tree}
She has ten total trees because {total_good_oranges_per_month} / {average_good_oranges_per_tree} = <<{total_good_oranges_per_month}/{average_good_oranges_per_tree}={total_trees}>>{total_trees}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Each tree A gives her six good oranges a month 10 x 0.6 = <<10*0.6=6>>6
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Each tree B gives her five good oranges a month because 15 x (1/3) = <<15*(1/3)=5>>5
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: On average, a tree gives her 5.5 oranges a month because 0.5(6) + 0.5(5) = 5.5
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: She has ten total trees because 55 / 5 = <<55/5=11>>11

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'good_oranges_tree_b' (value: 5.0) was used instead of 'average_good_oranges_per_tree' (value: 5.5).
